meanings.definition: To predict or foretell future events.
meanings.sent1: I will prophesize that it will rain tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She likes to prophesize about what the future holds.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to prophesize when the next meal would be served.
meanings.sent4: His wrinkled hands seemed to prophesize the hardships he had faced.
meanings.sent5: The old book seemed to prophesize the events of the coming year.

meanings.definition: To speak or write with divine inspiration or as a prophet.
meanings.sent1: The wise man would often prophesize about peace and harmony.
meanings.sent2: In ancient times, prophets would prophesize about the future.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to prophesize the next words its owner would say.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes seemed to prophesize the wisdom of the ages.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scroll seemed to prophesize the fate of kingdoms.

meanings.definition: To make a prediction or forecast.
meanings.sent1: The meteorologist will prophesize the weather for the week.
meanings.sent2: He likes to prophesize the outcomes of sports games.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller tried to prophesize the stock market trends.
meanings.sent4: The crystal ball seemed to prophesize the future of the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The old farmer seemed to prophesize the success of his crops.
